page.title: 15LIVING ON A FARM
page.content: Working on a farm now in 1985 is a lot easier than it was about 100 years ago.Now we have tractors instead of horses, which can go faster and have more power. Horses got tired easily, but tractors don't, although they can breakdown! Farmers now have combine- harvesters, which can harvest about 50 acres a day, but 100 years ago you harvested by hand, doing barely an acre a day. Then you had to bundle the straw up. But with a bailer (An automatic straw bundler,) you can do it in less than half of the time. A hundred years ago, setting seed was done by hand. They put the seed in a pouch, with their hand they scattered the seed across the land.
